newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asia Fuel Oil - Offers abound, but no buyers seen.
newsitem.headline: Asia Fuel Oil - Offers abound, but no buyers seen.

text.p: High sulphur fuel oil prices came under pressure with supplies weighing down the market amid crude losses, traders said on Monday.
Traders said some supplies that have been sold to Chinese buyers who had refused to take the cargoes were making their way back to Singapore.
One potential Chinese buyer valued these cargoes at about $102 per tonne on a cost and freight (c-and-f) basis to southern China, compared to the current $108-$113 per tonne.
Traders said some unsold supplies have been disposed in the bunker market. Bunker demand has picked up in a rush ahead of the New Year by shipowners to cover requirements ahead of the holidays.
In the LSWR market, an offer was heard for supplies loading in February at $20.25 a barrel against scarce bids. Another major said he would offer at $20.50.
Traders demand remained weak with Indonesia expected to allocate more supplies for February.
(Prices in dollars per tonne, unless stated)
MTH FOB SIN BUY/SELL PREV BUY/SELL
